docs.title: ERA Software
docs.text: Tools from the **Engineering Risk Analysis (ERA)** community for **uncertainty quantification**, **reliability**, and **Bayesian inference** in engineering. docs.title: What’s here
docs.text: -   :material-chart-bell-curve: **UQ base layer**      Distributions, dependence models, sampling utilities.       → Start with **eraUQ**.  -   :material-shield-check: **Reliability**      Rare-event estimation and structural reliability methods.  -   :material-bayesian: **Bayesian inference**      Sampling-based Bayesian updating and sequential methods.  -   :material-function-variant: **Surrogates**      Surrogate modelling for accelerating UQ & reliability loops.

docs.title: Software catalog
docs.text:
A curated set of ERA-Software tools for uncertainty quantification, reliability analysis, Bayesian inference, and surrogate modeling.

- :material-chart-bell-curve: **eraUQ** Base library for uncertainty quantification and reliability workflows: probability distributions (e.g., `ERADist`, `EmpDist`), dependence models (e.g., Nataf/Gaussian copula), and related utilities. [:octicons-mark-github-16: Repo](https://github.com/ERA-Software/eraUQ) · [:material-package-variant: PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/eraUQ/) · [:material-notebook: Notebook](https://github.com/ERA-Software/eraUQ#example-notebook) - :material-shield-check: **Reliability analysis tools (Python)** Methods for reliability analysis and rare-event probability estimation. Includes classic workhorses such as **FORM**, **Cross-Entropy / iCE**, **Subset Simulation**, **Sequential Importance Sampling**, and **Line Sampling variants**. [:octicons-mark-github-16: Listed in Overview](https://github.com/ERA-Software/Overview) - :material-bayesian: **Bayesian inference tools (Python)** Sampling-based Bayesian inference methods, including **BUS** (Bayesian Updating with Structural reliability methods), **Adaptive BUS**, **iTMCMC**, and **SMC-style** algorithms. [:octicons-mark-github-16: Listed in Overview](https://github.com/ERA-Software/Overview) - :material-function-variant: **Surrogate modelling (Python)** Surrogate modelling tools for UQ, including **Partial-Least-Squares-based Polynomial Chaos Expansion (PLS-PCE)** (as listed in your org overview). [:octicons-mark-github-16: Listed in Overview](https://github.com/ERA-Software/Overview)

docs.title: How these pieces fit together
docs.text:
A typical workflow looks like:

  1. Define uncertainty (marginals + dependence) with eraUQ
  2. Approximate expensive models with surrogate modelling (optional but often essential)
  3. Estimate failure probability with reliability tools
  4. Update with data using Bayesian inference tools (e.g., BUS / iTMCMC)
  5. Use results for decisions (risk, inspection, design, etc.)
